div.l: Right in the same chambre by ⁊and by
It mighte be no bet and the cause why
Ther was no Romer herberwe in the place
Thei soupen and þei speken hem to solace
And drinken euere strong ale atte beste
Aboute mydnyght wente þei to reste
Wel haþ this mellere vernisshed his heed
Ful pale he was for dronken ⁊and not reed
He ȝexeth and he speketh þorugh þe nose
As he were on þe quakke or on the pose
To bedde he goth and with him goth his wyf
As any Iay he light was ⁊and iolyf
So was hir ioly whistel wel I wette
The cradell at hire beddes feet is I sette
To rokken and to ȝeue þe child to souke
And whan þat dronken was all in þe crouke
To bedde wente the doughter right anon
To bedde goth Aleyn ⁊and also Iohn
There nas no more hem neded no dwale
Þis Millere haþ so wisely bibed Ale
That as an hors he snorteth in his slepe
Ne of his taile be hynde he took no kepe
His wyf bar him a burdoıı̄un ful stronge
Men mighten hem here rowtyng a forlonge
The wenche rowteth eke ꝑpar companye
Alayn the clerk þat herde this melodie
He pouked Iohn and seide slepest þow
Herdest þou euere slike a song or now
Lo swilke a couplyng is bitwixe hem alle
A wylde fuyre on theire bodies falle
Ho herde euere swilke a ferly þing
Ye þei sall haue the flour of ille ending
¶ This longe nyght þere tides me no reste
But ȝit no force all schal be for þe beste
For Iohn seide he as euer mote I thryue
If þat I may ȝon wenche wil I swyue
Some esement haþ lawe schapen vs
For Iohn þere is a lawe þat seith þus
